interestingFact: The United States has no official language, though English is the most commonly spoken.
Germany is home to the world’s first-ever printed book by Johannes Gutenberg.
Tokyo is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
India is the largest producer of films in the world, with Bollywood producing over 1,000 movies annually.
France is the most visited country in the world, with nearly 90 million tourists annually.
China is the world's oldest continuous civilization, dating back over 4,000 years.
Brazil is the only country in South America where Portuguese is the official language.
The UK is home to the world's oldest parliamentary democracy.
Australia is home to over 10,000 beaches—enough to visit one every day for 27 years!
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
